summary: This is a cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, Audrey Strauss, to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the sender of the letter, transmitting discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the recipient of the discovery materials for her criminal case, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as the U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against Maxwell and is responsible for providing discovery.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of April 2021.
The document references the ongoing criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)'.
Audrey Strauss was the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
